page.title: 05Woodland of the area.
page.content: The whole area is well wooded with mature deciduous trees and conifers. Beech, Oak, Ash, Sycamore and Larch grow to full size in the hedgerows, along the streams and roadsides and round the golf links. An extensive area of ancient natural woodland stretches along both sides of the river Gelt. The wood is managed by the Brampton Parish Council and is open to the public. Beech and Oak predominate but there is a huge variety including Wych Elm to Western Hemlock. The conifers present have been planted, and some felling and re-planting goes on. The undercover is mainly bracken and bilberry. A footpath goes right through the wood from Low Gelt Bridge to the Middle Gelt with other pathways leading from it.
